home
A tool to manage classpaths and clojure namespaces on a persistent JVM

Getting started

Download the jark self extracting script server and client or only the client

server> cp jark-0.3 ~/bin/jark (PATH)
server> jark install

or to install just the client

client> jark-0.3-client ~/bin/jark (PATH)
client> jark install

The install command extracts relevant files to ~/.cljr and ~/.config/jark
Mac OSX users: install GNU getopt

The VM can be started on any available port.

server> jark vm start [--port]

To connect, do

client> jark vm connect [--host] [--port]

In the above, host defaults to localhost and port to 2113. Any number of JVM instances can be started.

Now, just launch a repl and write some clojure!

client> jark ns repl NAMESPACE
or simply
client> jark repl [NAMESPACE (default:user)]

Jark commands can be run from within the repl, using the ‘/’ prefix:

user>> /cp list
....

We can switch on/off the nrepl debug-mode

user>> /debug on
debug is ON
user>> (+ 2 2)
put : (+ 2 2)
got : {u'status': u'done', u'ns': u'user', u'id': u'localhost:9000-repl', u'value': u'4\n'}
4
user>> /debug off

Have a look at the other sections for some useful utilities.
